entry.title: Git Tutorials
entry.content:
Git git -

MAC
Windows
Linux

  • git init git
  • git clone /path/to/repository git clone username@host:/path/to/repository
  • git Index HEAD
  • git diff git diff --stat
  • git add <filename> git add * git git commit -m "" HEAD
  • HEAD git push origin master master git remote add origin <server> git remote -v
  • master git checkout -b feature_x feature_x git checkout master git checkout master git push origin <branch> git branch
  • git pull git merge <branch> mastergit git add <filename> git diff <source_branch> <target_branch>
  • git tag 1.0.0 1b2e1d63ff 1.0.0 1b2e1d63ff ID 10 git log ID ID
  • git log
  • git checkout -- <filename> HEAD git fetch origin git reset --hard origin/master

terminal window ""pane ""session

Mac OS brew tmux :brew install tmux

tmux

tmux tmux tmux ctrl + b , tmux

tmux

tmux / tmux new -s <session-name>
tmux detach (ctrl + b) d
tmux ls (ctrl + b) s
ta/tmux attach -t <session-name>
tmux kill-session -t <session-name> ctrl + d
tmux switch -t <session-name>
tmux rename-session -t <old-session-name> <new-session-name> (ctrl +b) $

tmux

tmux split-window -h (ctrl + b) %
tmux split-window (ctrl + b)
tmux select-pane -U (ctrl +b)
tmux select-pane -D (ctrl +b)
tmux select-pane -L (ctrl +b)
tmux select-pane -R (ctrl +b)
(ctrl +b) ;
(ctrl +b) o
tmux swap-pane -U
tmux swap-pane -D

(ctrl +b) z
(ctrl +b) t Enter

tmux select-window -t <window-name> (ctrl +b) w j,k
(ctrl +b) n
(ctrl +b) p

tmux kill-window -t <window-name> (ctrl +b) &

entry.title: PySpark DataFrame Pandas DataFrame
entry.content:
PySpark Pandas DataFrame
Referencepyspark --pandas pyspark ;Pandas PySpark DataFrame ;PySpark API;Pandas API

  • PySpark
    parallelism in-memory distributed Hadoop

  • Pandas
    single machine tool parallelism Hadoop

  • PySpark
    lazy-evaluated

  • Pandas
    not lazy-evaluated

Lazy Evaluationcall-by-need

  • PySpark
    persist () or cache () RDDs

  • Pandas

DataFrame

  • PySpark
    Spark RDDs DataFrame

  • Pandas
    Pandas DataFrame

  • PySpark
    spark_df = sc.parallelize([(1, 2), (3, 4)]).toDF(['xx', 'yy']
    pandas_df spark_df = SQLContext.createDataFrame(pandas_df)
    createDataFrame list spark_df list tupledictrdd
    CSV spark_df = spark.read.csv(csv_path, header=True) CSV header
    parquet spark_df = spark.read.parquet(parquet_path)
    json spark_df = spark.read.json(json_path)
    txt spark_df = sc.textFile(txt_path).toDF()
    path HDFS

  • Pandas
    pandas_df = pd.DataFrame({'xx': {0: 1, 1: 3}, 'yy': {0: 2, 1: 4}})
    spark_df pandas_df = spark_df.toPandas()

index

  • PySpark
    index
    df.withColumn('index', F.row_number().over(Window.orderBy(F.monotonically_increasing_id())))
    df.rdd.zipWithIndex().toDF().select(F.col('_1').getItem('col_name_1').alias('col_name_1'), F.col('_2').getItem('col_name_2').alias('col_name_2'), ..., F.col('_n').getItem('col_name_n').alias('col_name_n'), F.col('_(n+1)').alias('row_index'))

  • Pandas

pandas_df spark_df spark_df = SQLContext.createDataFrame(pandas_df.reset_index())

  • PySpark
    Row Spark DataFrame

  • Pandas
    Series Pandas DataFrame

  • PySpark
    Column Spark DataFrame DataFrame[name: string]

  • Pandas
    Series Pandas DataFrame

  • PySpark
    alias
    df.withColumnRenamed('old_name', 'new_name')

  • Pandas

    df.rename(columns={'old_name': 'new_name'})

  • PySpark
    df['xx'] df.withColumn('xx', 1)

  • Pandas
    df['xx'] df['xx'] = 1

  • PySpark
    1. df show df.show(5)
    2. DataFrame[age: bigint, name: string]
    3. df.printSchema()
    4. df.columns
  • Pandas
    df

  • PySpark
    df.sort(df.xx.asc(),df.yy.desc())
    df.sort(F.asc('xx'),F.desc('yy'))
    df.sort(F.col("xx").asc(), F.col("yy").desc())
    df.orderBy(F.col("xx").asc(), F.col("yy").desc())

  • Pandas
    df.sort_index()
    df.sort_values(['xx', 'yy'], ascending=[True, False])
    df.sort_values(['xx', 'yy'], axis=0)df.sort_values([1, 2], axis=1)

  • PySpark
    1. df.select('xx', 'yy')
    2. df.first() Row(col_name1=value1, col_name2=value2, ...)
    3. df.head(n)df.take(n) n df.tail(n) n
    4. df.collect()
  • Pandas
    1. df.xxdf['xx'] xx df [k] k
    2. df.iat[:, k]df.iloc[:, k] k df.iat[k]df.iloc[k] k

  • PySpark
    df.filter(df['xx']>k) df.where(df['xx']>k)

  • Pandas
    df[df['xx']>k] s[s>k]

  • PySpark
    df.groupBy('xx') df.groupBy('xx').avg('yy').show()
    from pyspark.sql import functions
    df.groupBy('xx').agg(functions.avg('yy'), functions.min('yy'), functions.max('yy')).show()

  • Pandas
    df.groupby('xx')
    df.groupby('xx').avg('yy')

  • PySpark
    df.count()
    df.describe() count, mean, stddev, min, max

  • Pandas
    df.count()
    df.shape
    df.describe() count, mean, std, min, 25%, 50%, 75%, max

  • PySpark
    df.join()


    df.union() df a.union (b) a
    df.unoinAll() union
    df.unionByName() df

  • Pandas
    Pandas concat
    Pandas merge

    df.join()
    df.append()

  • PySpark
    1. df.drop('xx') df.drop(F.col('xx'))
    2. df.drop(*['xx', 'yy', ...])
    3. filter
  • Pandas
    1. df.drop(['xx', 'xx'], axis=1) df.drop(columns=['xx', 'yy'])
    2. df.drop([0, 1]) 01 index

  • PySpark
    1. df = df.withColumn('xx', F.col('xx').cast(Type()))
  • Pandas
    1. df.astype('type')
    2. df.astype({'xx': 'int32'})

  • PySpark
    1. NaNs
    2. fillna df.na.fill()
    3. dropna df.na.drop()
  • Pandas
    1. NaNs
    2. fillna df.fillna()
    3. dropna df.dropna()

SQL

  • PySpark
    1. DataFrame SQL
      df.registerTempTable('tt') sqlContext.registerDataFrameAsTable(df, 'tt')
      spark.sql('SELECT xx, yy FROM tt WHERE xx >= m AND yy <= n')
    2. SQL
      spark.registerFunction('stringLengthString', lambda x: len(x))
      spark.sql("SELECT stringLengthString('test')")
  • Pandas
    import sqlite3
    pd.read_sql('SELECT xx, yy FROM tt WHERE xx >= m AND yy <= n')

  • PySpark
    pandas_df = spark_df.toPandas()

  • Pandas
    spark_df = spark.createDataFrame(pandas_df)
    TypeError: field XXX: Can not merge type A and B
    String
    pandas_df.XXX = pandas_df.XXX.astype(str)

  • Pandas
    df.apply(f) df f

  • PySpark
    df.foreach(f) df.rdd.foreach(f) df f
    df.foreachPartition(f) df.rdd.foreachPartition(f) df f

map-reduce

  • Pandas
    map-reducemap(func, list)reduce(func, list) seq
  • PySpark
    df.map(func)df.reduce(func) seqRDDs

diff

  • Pandas
    diff Pandas
  • PySpark
    diff Spark

Most Common

  • Pandas
    df.value_counts(ascending=False)
  • PySpark
    df.cube(column_name).count().sort('count', ascending=False).show(5)

entry.title: Python Web - CherryPy
entry.content:
CherryPy is a pythonic, object-oriented web framework.
CherryPy allows developers to build web applications in much the same way they would build any other object-oriented Python program. This results in smaller source code developed in less time.
ReferenceGitHub

$ pip install cherrypy
GitHub CherryPy


$ python -m cherrypy.tutorial.tut01_helloworld
http://127.0.0.1:8080 http://localhost:8080
log

Hello World



signal127.0.0.1:8080
returnindex
- "Hello world!"
- HTML


- HTML open('xxx/xxx/xxx.html')

open("xxx.html").read().format(a=a, b=b, c=c, ...)HTML {a:}; {b:}; {c:}; ...
open("xxx.html").read() % (a, b, c, ...)HTML %s;%d;%f
open("xxx.html").read() string

cherrypy.quickstart()
cherrypy.tree.mount() cherrypy.quickstart()

    \[\begin{pmatrix} 1 & a_1 & a_1^2 & \cdots & a_1^n \\ 1 & a_2 & a_2^2 & \cdots & a_2^n \\ \vdots & \vdots& \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\ 1 & a_m & a_m^2 & \cdots & a_m^n \end{pmatrix}\]

  14. \begin{cases}\end{cases} \ &
    \[f(n) = \begin{cases} a, & \text{if $n$ is even} \\ b, & \text{if $n$ is odd} \\ \end{cases}\]

  15. \frac
    \frac /
    \[\begin{array}{cc} \mathrm{Bad} & \mathrm{Better} \\ \hline \\ e^{i\frac{\pi}2} \quad e^{\frac{i\pi}2}& e^{i\pi/2} \\ \int_{-\frac\pi2}^\frac\pi2 \sin x\,dx & \int_{-\pi/2}^{\pi/2}\sin x\,dx \\ \end{array}\]
    \mid |
    | \mid
    \[\begin{array}{cc} \mathrm{Bad} & \mathrm{Better} \\ \hline \\ {x|x^2\in\Bbb Z} & {x\mid x^2\in\Bbb Z} \\ \end{array}\]
    \, LaTex
    \[\begin{array}{cc} \mathrm{Bad} & \mathrm{Better} \\ \hline \\ \iiint_V f(x)dz dy dx & \iiint_V f(x)\,dz\,dy\,dx \end{array}\]

  16. \cfrac \frac \over
    \[x = a_0 + \frac{1^2}{a_1 + \frac{2^2}{a_2 + \frac{3^2}{a_3 + \frac{4^4}{a_4 + \cdots}}}} \tag{\frac}\]
    \[x = a_0 + \cfrac{1^2}{a_1 + \cfrac{2^2}{a_2 + \cfrac{3^2}{a_3 + \cfrac{4^4}{a_4 + \cdots}}}} \tag{\cfrac}\]

  17. \begin{array} \end{array} \left{\right.
    \[\begin{array}{c} a_1x+b_1y+c_1z=d_1 \\ a_2x+b_2y+c_2z=d_2 \\ a_3x+b_3y+c_3z=d_3 \end{array}\]
    \begin{cases}\end{cases}
    \[\begin{cases} a_1x+b_1y+c_1z=d_1 \\ a_2x+b_2y+c_2z=d_2 \\ a_3x+b_3y+c_3z=d_3 \end{cases}\]
    = \being{aligned} .. \end{aligned}
    \[\begin{aligned} a_1x+b_1y+c_1z &=d_1+e_1 \\ a_2x+b_2y&=d_2 \\ a_3x+b_3y+c_3z &=d_3 \end{aligned}\]
    = \being{array}{} .. \end{array}
    \[\begin{array}{ll} a_1x+b_1y+c_1z &=d_1+e_1 \\ a_2x+b_2y &=d_2 \\ a_3x+b_3y+c_3z &=d_3 \end{array}\]

  18. HTML4 CSS2
    \[\begin{array}{|rc|} \hline \verb+\color{black}{text}+ & \color{black}{text} \\ \verb+\color{gray}{text}+ & \color{gray}{text} \\ \verb+\color{silver}{text}+ & \color{silver}{text} \\ \verb+\color{white}{text}+ & \color{white}{text} \\ \hline \verb+\color{maroon}{text}+ & \color{maroon}{text} \\ \verb+\color{red}{text}+ & \color{red}{text} \\ \verb+\color{yellow}{text}+ & \color{yellow}{text} \\ \verb+\color{lime}{text}+ & \color{lime}{text} \\ \verb+\color{olive}{text}+ & \color{olive}{text} \\ \verb+\color{green}{text}+ & \color{green}{text} \\ \verb+\color{teal}{text}+ & \color{teal}{text} \\ \verb+\color{aqua}{text}+ & \color{aqua}{text} \\ \verb+\color{blue}{text}+ & \color{blue}{text} \\ \verb+\color{navy}{text}+ & \color{navy}{text} \\ \verb+\color{purple}{text}+ & \color{purple}{text} \\ \verb+\color{fuchsia}{text}+ & \color{magenta}{text} \\ \hline \end{array}\]
    HTML5 CSS3 #rgb rgb 16 \color{\#0F0}{text} HTML CSS

  19. \[\require{cancel}\begin{array}{rl} \verb|y+\cancel{x}| & y+\cancel{x}\\ \verb|\cancel{y+x}| & \cancel{y+x}\\ \verb|y+\bcancel{x}| & y+\bcancel{x}\\ \verb|y+\xcancel{x}| & y+\xcancel{x}\\ \verb|y+\cancelto{0}{x}| & y+\cancelto{0}{x}\\ \verb+\frac{1\cancel9}{\cancel95} = \frac15+& \frac{1\cancel9}{\cancel95} = \frac15 \\ \end{array}\]
    \[\require{enclose}\begin{array}{rl} \verb|\enclose{horizontalstrike}{x+y}| & \enclose{horizontalstrike}{x+y}\\ \verb|\enclose{verticalstrike}{\frac xy}| & \enclose{verticalstrike}{\frac xy}\\ \verb|\enclose{updiagonalstrike}{x+y}| & \enclose{updiagonalstrike}{x+y}\\ \verb|\enclose{downdiagonalstrike}{x+y}| & \enclose{downdiagonalstrike}{x+y}\\ \verb|\enclose{horizontalstrike,updiagonalstrike}{x+y}| & \enclose{horizontalstrike,updiagonalstrike}{x+y}\\ \end{array}\]

  20. Hexo MathJax

    LaTeX

Some Tips

  1. $ hexo g $ hexo d $ hexo g -d
  2. $ git add . $ git commit -m "add to GitHub" $ git commit -a -m "add to GitHub"
  3. push push $ git push
